text: Sicamus Aëtius (), sometimes called Aëtius Sicanius or Siculus, was a Byzantine medical writer and the author of a treatise On Melancholy (), Latin De Melancholia, which is commonly printed among the works of Galen.Vol. xix. p. 699, &c.; His date is uncertain, but if he is not the same person as Aëtius of Amida, he must have lived after him, as his treatise corresponds exactly with part of the latter's great medical work.tetrab. ii. semi. ii. 9 —11, p. 250, &c.; It is compiled from Galen, Rufus of Ephesus, Posidonius, and Marcellus Empiricus. ==References== * Category:Ancient Greek science writers Category:Year of death unknown Category:Year of birth unknown
title: Sicamus Aëtius
